replies.body: The problems Aatrox have are, as nicely described as I can think of, numerous. His power is shifted inconsistently in his abilities, and his theme of "drain-tank God of War" is muddied by balance issues. His passive GA is so strong an ability that if they gave him power elsewhere he'd be OP as hell. Even if he's meant to be a drain tank, constantly trading around health in order to survive a fight, the only way he can do this is to AA people, so basically kite him and he becomes useless, unlike all the other drain tanks in this game that can actually benefit from the different sources of healing they have. His skillshots are extremely tough to land and have horrible cooldowns, even though he relies on them incredibly in order to be effective. His Blood Well encourages tankiness but his health costs discourage it, he has the kit of a fighter needing defenses to survive but the ratios of a carry that needs a lot of late game stats to do damage (AD, crit, armor penetration) yet he doesn't scale super well with any of it. On top of it all his kit is just... bland. Q jumps on people, W heals/extra damage every 3rd hit, E damages and slows, R gives a bunch of buffs, and if you die your passive saves you (if it's up). All of this pooled together creates a clusterfuck of ideas with no direction. That is Aatrox.
I agree. Aatrox really needs a ground up rework, unfortunately.

I don't think he needs a ground-up rework.  Things I could see staying mostly untouched on him are his passive and his Q.  After that, they should take a long look at his lore and modify the rest of his kit based upon that.  Aatrox is supposed to be an avatar of war who inspires army to fight back from the brink of defeat.  He cuts down mortal men by 10 at once.  If such is the case, why is the only thing that Aatrox is strong at is dueling?  

He should be a lot like Jarvan, a team-centric bruiser who dives into a fight.  He would protect his allies or slaughter his foes.  He should thrive right in the center of a fight where he can make the most use of his abilities.  That's not to say he would be a tank (far from it).  Aatrox still has an identity as a DPS fighter with potent healing.  What he needs to make use of it is proper durability and sticking power (both which he lacks currently) while still dealing reasonable damage.

Aatrox's current problems?  The impact of his attack speed steroids is diminished by the fact that he has two of them (and one is his R, the other is attached to Blood Well).  When he's strong he is immensely frustrating because he has no limit to his sustain on W.  He'll max E, poke you down in lane with it.  If you trade, he'll disengage with E and sustain with his W healing just by CS'ing.  What he needs is more interactivity, inherent counter-play, and in turn he gains the tools he needs to thrive.  Basically, the whole "heal from auto-attacking" idea is an archaic design that results in binary gameplay.  Putting a potentially huge heal onto a reasonable cooldown and adding requirements for it's usage is much healthier.

I've actually theory-crafted an Aatrox rework which could solve a lot of issues with him, which I posted [here](http://www.reignofgaming.net/forums/rog-user-content/written-work/123799-concept-for-aatrox-rework).  Basically it makes him a much stronger team-fighter (and healthier drain-tank) in concept.  I left damage and healing numbers out just in the case of poorly thought-out math.

I would say, however, he needs a quality of life change where if you Auto then Q it keeps on the same target, so you don't end up killing yourself because you Blood Priced a minion, his passive is used mostly to survive teamfights, not fight through them, and help him either equal or win a 1v1/1v2. So all I have to say is, your combo is Q, E, Bork active, Ult, Blood Price hit, and then just try to survive off of lifesteal and health and your W.  If your combo didn't kill someone, then you don't have either a team with you, or are behind. 
His Lore put his Gameplay beautifully. He Inspired the group he was helping. You have to do the same with your group, you work as a team, you can't just go off and do you own thing. 
__BASICALLY, You need a tank support with initiation, then you can do your initiation and you everything will be beautiful.

Thirdly, he has 2 AS steroids passive and ult... which is kinda meh, because this means he can't have damage because he naturally attacks fast and that would be broken.

I propose making him with a passive that gives his blood well and ties it to an ability W. so with every hit (skill or AA) builds the bloodwell up, and like{{champion:223}}, out of combat it eats up the bloodwell for passive health regen. and w empowers the next AA and deals X damage on the next AA and only that one AA, and has 30% armor penetration for that Attack only. does not have a time limit you have to hit within x secs, but is a pure empowered hit guaranteed. Giving Aatrox a way to use his bloodwell 2 different ways, sustain while sacrificing csing or combat, or damage, giving up on the only sustain he would have now minus items. W no longer is what it was.

Q, change it so that upon cast you become invincible .5 sec after cast until landing, knocking up enemies in the center and slowing on the outer edge. making it Actually reliable as an escape or engage, and if not too much to ask, make it reset on kill. because he has 0 mobilty other than it {{champion:121}}{{champion:18}}  has it, why not a top laner for once.

E, i think is fairly good in all respects and doesn't need too much change, its a farm tool i always find, and poke for a melee champ.

Ult HOOOO boy does it work decently at times, but in others it's just meh, instantaneous damage upon cast (AP), change to a lower ad value, Range increase fine, AS buff fine, but i would like to see if they can buff it to give him the ability to buff an ally too, jungler/support(if that were to work) through giving allies and only allies some aura that can increase either defenses, or crit chance, or something that ties into his lore inspiring people to fight on against all odds, becoming more than they normally are. Even buffing minions would be an awesome help. buffing minions isn't something that has been done really.

But Aatrox I find always seems gimped in every matchup because he is an all in champ that hurts himself to do damage, and has no survivabilty in large cc comps that are everywhere right now that easily shut him down.
Aatrox at the moment is all on snowballing. He either is fed or useless

Because Warwick's gapcloser + hard CC is his ult and must target a unit, and Aatrox's is a regular spell that is also free targeted and can go over walls?  Oh and Aatrox also has another CC, which is also on a non-ult CD.

There are plenty of other differences too, but Aatrox definitely has more CC.

Aatrox has some huge glaring flaws, much of it having to do with how his kit doesn't really reflect his lore, and how his abilities are not very synergistic.

With that being said, a good player on Aatrox can do some pretty amazing things ESPECIALLY when the enemy team feels that he is a handicap champion. Aatrox is a niche pick for dive and knock-up comps and he deals a surprising amount of damage in the early part of the game. Despite his early damage, he falls off pretty hard, pretty fast due to polarized itemization requirements. 

He honestly only needs a couple of small tweaks to get him into decent shape. 
One of the big tweaks is that he needs some form of hard CC on top of his R, commonly accepted as a .5 second AoE fear (which honestly just gives him the opportunity to Q + R + AA without getting instagibbed... providing his Q actually lands)

Another tweak is that his Q animation needs to be much smoother, mostly because it doesn't have that great of range, it doesn't have great knockup or damage, and it is extremely predictable and can be countered by SOOOOO many abilities. Just simply making the animation more fluid will give him a decent boost in power because he wouldn't have that stupid "I'M GOING TO JUMP NOW" wind up that you can see a mile off

As for a large adjustment that needs made, his R needs to have a "Massacre" feel that goes in with his Lore, about him leading troops into battle. Something that benefits the TEAM as a whole like added Attack Speed, Life Steal, or Movement Speed, or when he uses his E it explodes in a burst instead of a reverse cone, basically just anything creative that makes his ult advantageous to use in a team fight because right now it is really only used to drop towers (relatively fast with your wet noodle sword) or hit your enemies super fast with your wet noodle sword.


Speaking of the wet noodle sword... When Aatrox drops off it is noticed as him attacking super fast but appearing to do no damage which is called "The Wet Noodle" effect :)

I've made some good plays against some good players. It's fun to play Aatrox but he's so out of place! People make ideas to improve and so have I and we all really want to see him improved!
